New Records: The Hornets and Bulls combined to miss 150 3-point shots in two games, setting a record.
They set the NBA record for most combined threes made in a single game with 22-of-97 from beyond the arc.
They tied the previous record for most combined missed 3s in a game with 10-of-43.
Key Match Events: The Hornets and Bulls combined to miss 75 3-point shots in each of their two head-to-head matchups.
The Bulls shot 60 3s and made 18 of them in their second meeting.
The Hornets went 10-of-43 from beyond the arc in their second meeting.
Pre-Game Insights: Fans are flabbergasted by the sheer volume of shots from beyond the arc given that the Hornets and Bulls do not have a legitimate 3-point threat.
Fans are blaming the amount of 3s as the main reason why the NBA's ratings are down.
Post-Match Reflections: Shaquille O'Neal blames Steph Curry for changing the way teams play and making the game boring.
Fans are discussing the ongoing online chatter about why the NBA ratings are on the decline and the number of 3s being called the culprit.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The average number of attempts from 3s this season is 37.6 shots per game.
The Boston Celtics take a whopping NBA-leading 50.7 attempts per game, making 36.4% of it.
Others: Miles Bridges, who is shooting 27.7% from 3 this season, chucked 13 of them on Monday.
Coby White went 1-of-11 from beyond the arc while Bulls center Jalen Smith was 1-of-6 off the bench.
